CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to several types of attacks. It exposes sensitive information through error messages (CWE-200). It does not limit the number of attempts to boot the server, which can lead to a Denial of Service attack (CWE-400). It does not implement any CSRF protection, making it vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks (CWE-352). It also does not properly sanitize user input before using it to generate
